item.title: LDAP
item.description: It doesn’t happen to me very often, but every now and again I run into an LDAP problem. It usually shows up as I can’t log into a system that everyone knows authenticates against the LDAP server. Or, even rarer, I’m building something that authenticates against, or takes configuration from, an LDAP server. The most important thing to understand about LDAP is that it is a read optimized, hierarchical database. Since it’s a database, you need a connection URL, the query language, and enough of the schema to know what to query.
